definition: square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: Whig opposition was not strong enough to defeat all the president's proposals.
sentences.chinese: 輝格黨的反對不足以阻止總統的所有的建議。

sentences.english: Whigs, on the other hand, were more comfortable with the market.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，輝格黨對市場比較滿意。

sentences.english: In retaliation, the Whigs expelled Tyler from their party.
sentences.chinese: 由於政見的牴觸，泰勒被輝格黨開除出黨。

sentences.english: The act was supported by both Whigs and Tories.
sentences.chinese: 輝格黨和託利黨都支持該法案。

sentences.english: The Whigs argued that such a law would give presidents too much power over the economy.
sentences.chinese: 輝格黨認爲這樣一部法律給予總統太大的經濟權力。

sentences.english: Whig Party in the US in pre-Civil-War times.
sentences.chinese: 在美國內戰前期輝格黨成員。

sentences.english: The opposition Whig Party was happy over Van Buren's failures.
sentences.chinese: 反對黨輝格黨看到範布倫的失敗很高興。

sentences.english: The Whigs believed they could defeat President Martin Van Buren in his attempt to win a second term.
sentences.chinese: 輝格黨認爲他們能夠擊敗試圖連任的現任總統範布倫。

sentences.english: Whigs became more representative of northern business and farming interests.
sentences.chinese: 輝格黨更多的代表了北方工商農階級的利益。

sentences.english: The Tories and the Whigs were alternatively in power for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，輝格黨和託利黨輪流掌權。
